title: Identity | Academic Computing and Communications Center | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: The ACCC Mission, Vision, Values, Principles and Strategic Goals define who we are and our priorities.
To enable excellence through information technology
To be a trusted strategic partner for innovative and transformative information technology solutions
We work to develop, expand and enhance partnerships across the university and its community while promoting collaboration and shared knowledge.
We strive for the best customer service, are proactive in our planning and responsive when issues arise.
We utilize our talents to foster innovative and creative solutions.
We act responsibly, ethically, and without bias, basing our decisions on facts and data. We recognize our role as public employees and work sustainably and with stewardship.
We encourage professional and personal growth and respect the work/life balance of our employees. We show each other respect and listen to each other’s thoughts and ideas.
We openly communicate internally and with the university community to foster accountability.
As an organization, we agree to the following principles to guide our work.
The following organizational goals have short term and long term activities with detailed action plans and projects.
